about_the_game:
Satan was feeling lonely. The people simply don't care about eternal damnation like they used to. Maybe all hell needed was a promotional event to get people excited again. One day, he heard people arguing about how many toddlers they could beat in a fight and then he got an idea. If anyone could defeat 20 waves of toddlers they would acquire powers beyond their wildest imagination.

A Deal with the Devil 

At the end of each wave, choose between a variety of powerful upgrades, but each one comes at a cost! For example an upgrade might give a boost to damage after a reload, making it powerful if you reload your weapon often. However, the upgrade also reduces the knockback given to enemies. Many Faustian upgrades are able to be taken multiple times, stacking the benefits and drawbacks. So repeating that same upgrade may give you massive damage after you reload, but the knockback it inflicts is so reduced that it pulls enemies closer to you! Depending on the upgrades you choose, this could be a critical weakness in your strategy or an attribute you are able to overcome with the other power you have acquired.

Explore Unique weapons

Explore a variety of powerful weapons that each have two firing modes.

Including a Brella gun that has an automatic rifle component and an alt fire that shoots umbrellas that pushes back enemies and deletes projectiles,

A double barrel shotgun with an alt fire that shoots two barrels at once, increasing knock back and penetration while stunning enemies,

An AK-47 with Molotov launcher alt fire,

And many more!

short_description: The Hellspawn Trials is an endless top down shooter where you defeat hordes of demonic toddlers for otherworldly power.Choose from a variety of weapons and Faustian upgrades to create unique builds to discover the answer to the ultimate question: How many toddlers can you beat in a fight?
